title: Can anyone help me understand the 'Du Hast' music video by Rammstein? - Quora

response.answer_text: As someone else has already written, it's about loyalty. Going to the end with someone else... Difficult to explain. The lyrics are based on a tonal match of the words "hast" and "hasst". "Du hast“ means "you have“ “Du hasst mich" means "you hate me“ This ambiguity is used in the text. Similarly, the two words at the end of the lyrics: "scheidet“ and "Scheide" “Willst du, bis der Tod uns scheidet, treu sein?“ means “Do you want to be faithful until death separates us?" “Willst du, bis zum Tod der Scheide, treu sein? Sie lieben auch in schlechten Tagen?“ means “Do you want to be faithful until the death of the cunt/vagina? Love her even in bad days?“ GERMAN LYRICS: Du, du hast (hasst) ... Du hast (hasst) mich. Du, du hast (hasst) ... Du hast (hasst) mich. Du, du hast (hasst) ... Du hast (hasst) mich. Du, du hast (hasst) ... Du hast (hasst) mich. Du hast mich gefragt Du hast mich gefragt Du hast mich gefragt und ich hab nichts gesagt. Willst du, bis der tod uns scheidet, treu sein? Für alle Tage? Nein! Nein! Willst du, bis der tod uns scheidet, treu sein? Für alle Tage? Nein! Nein! Du, du hast (hasst) ... Du hast (hasst) mich. Du, du hast (hasst) ... Du hast (hasst) mich. Du, du hast (hasst) ... Du hast (hasst) mich. Du, du hast (hasst) ... Du hast (hasst) mich. Du hast mich gefragt Du hast mich gefragt Du hast mich gefragt und ich hab nichts gesagt. Willst du, bis der tod uns scheidet, treu sein? Für alle Tage? Nein! Nein! Willst du, bis zum tod der scheide, treu sein? Sie lieben, auch in schlechten Tagen? Nein! Nein! Willst du, bis der tod uns scheidet, treu sein? Nein! Nein! TRANSLATION You, you have (or hate)... You have (hate) me. You, you have (hate)... You have (hate) me. You, you have (hate)... You have (hate) me. You, you have (hate)... You have (hate) me. You have ask me You have ask me You have ask me and I did not say anything. Do you want to be faithful until death separates us? For all days? No! No! Do you want to be faithful until death separates us? For all days? No! No! You, you have (hate)... You have (hate) me. You, you have (hate)... You have (hate) me. You, you have (hate)... You have (hate) me. You, you have (hate)... You have (hate) me. You have ask me You have ask me You have ask me and I did not say anything. Do you want to be faithful until death separates us? For all days? No! No! Do you want to be faithful until the death of the vagina? Love her even in bad days? No! No! Do you want to be faithful until death separates us? No! No!

From watching the video only: The couple appear to be kidnapped in the beginning and taken to an isolated area. The boyfriend kisses her in what may be his final moments as he is dragged away by the assailants and into a barn. After nightfall, she witnesses the horrible scene of (she thinks) her boyfriend having been set on fire and running across the padddock to his death. Next morning, the suited culprits appear in a ‘Usual Suspects’ slow-mo march toward the car. She must be terrified. But then, her boyfriend appears within the group. He gives her a steely look as they all proceed, without delay, right past the car. When at a safe distance, the boyfriend checks his watch as, on cue, the car and his girlfriend are blown up. The cuckolded boyfriend’s ruse to get the disloyal member of his group and his philandering girlfriend to this remote spot has succeeded. In her final moments the girlfriend must have put two and two together and understood that she had been found out. Mission accomplished.

Referring to the official video    This video is about a decission and about loyalty. The guy with the gun voted for the gang (Rammstein band members) against his partner who he kills with the car bomb in the end (which means, it was his plan before entering the barn).  The text corrolates with that. Central question is:"Willst du bis der Tod euch scheidettreu ihr sein für alle Tage"is a question of marital fidelity "will you be faithful to her til death do you part?" and the answer of the singer is "NEIN"  - "No!"
Have a look here: Rammstein - Du Hast (English Translation) Lyricswhere you'll find a translation and explanation.
